title: Mercedes India to hike new car prices by 3 percent
description: Mercedes-Benz India has announced that prices for its entire line-up will go up by 3 percent starting January 1, 2025. Mercedes GLC price to increase by Rs 2 lakh Mercedes-Maybach S680 V12 sedan prices to go up by Rs 9 lakh Price hike not applicable to units built by December 31 Mercedes price hike not applicable to models booked by December 31 The brand has clarified that the price hike will apply to vehicles not in stock by December 31, 2024, as well as to existing bookings and those made before this date. Mercedes-Benz India further says that the price hike has been conducted due to higher material costs, inflationary pressures, and logistic expenses, which lead to higher operational costs. This has been creating “substantial pressure” on the Mercedes-Benz business and its overall bottom line. The brand further says that it is “absorbing” most of the cost pressures and passing on a “nominal” portion to the market. Prices for the GLC SUV, which starts at Rs 75.90 lakh, will increase by around Rs 2 lakh, while prices for the Mercedes-Maybach S 680 V12 sedan, priced from Rs 3.43 crore, will go up by up to Rs 9 lakh. html:
As per the brand, the price hike has been implemented due to higher material costs, inflationary pressures, and other cost burdens.

Mercedes-Benz India has announced that prices for its entire line-up will go up by 3 percent starting January 1, 2025.

  1. Mercedes GLC price to increase by Rs 2 lakh
  2. Mercedes-Maybach S680 V12 sedan prices to go up by Rs 9 lakh
  3. Price hike not applicable to units built by December 31

Mercedes price hike not applicable to models booked by December 31

The brand has clarified that the price hike will apply to vehicles not in stock by December 31, 2024, as well as to existing bookings and those made before this date.

Mercedes-Benz India further says that the price hike has been conducted due to higher material costs, inflationary pressures, and logistic expenses, which lead to higher operational costs. This has been creating “substantial pressure” on the Mercedes-Benz business and its overall bottom line. The brand further says that it is “absorbing” most of the cost pressures and passing on a “nominal” portion to the market.

Prices for the GLC SUV, which starts at Rs 75.90 lakh, will increase by around Rs 2 lakh, while prices for the Mercedes-Maybach S 680 V12 sedan, priced from Rs 3.43 crore, will go up by up to Rs 9 lakh.
